about_the_game:
NeuroSquad is a Bullet Heaven / Action Roguelite game, where you can design your own guns by building them up modularly. Summon a group of holographic soldiers who fight alongside you as you control the whole squad!
In this game no upgrade is tied to a specific weapon, you can freely choose which gun gets which modifications.


Choose from a wide variety of pickups and upgrades! Customize your own attacks and discover powerful synergies! Set up your auto-attacking soldiers using neuro-implants. Summon them, make them stronger, turn them into killing machines!

Features

  • Weapon customization; Pair any weapon with any modification to build a whole custom arsenal.
  • Lots of unlockables, body augmentations, many different build types.
  • Optional extra challenges that provide higher difficulty for experienced players.
  • Full controller and keyboard + mouse support.
  • Ultrawide monitor support.
  • Dynamic cyber metal / trance metal soundtrack to slay the horde to.



Humanity is in the process of stepping out of the biological era. Brain enhancement, neural chips, and other body augmentations are part of this new reality. But a change this drastic was never going to happen without conflict and catastrophes. Rogue AI automatons are taking over crucial research facilities, attacking anyone who tries to stop them.

Now it's your turn to face their hordes. Using a neural implant, you can summon a squad of holographic soldiers, and call attack drones to fight on your side. The latest weapon types, such as the laser shotgun and biosense mines, as well as augmentations like the cyber aura will help you become stronger and wipe out the AI bots.

With each death you become more powerful. Each night is a new opportunity to save the future. Get ready to slay the horde!

Basic info

  • Genre: Action roguelike / Bullet heaven / Survivors like / Shoot 'Em Up / Twin-stick shooter / Bullet hell
  • Inspired by: Awesome games like Vampire Survivors / Soulstone Survivors / 20 Minutes Till Dawn / Brotato / Risk of Rain 2 / Halls of Torment
  • Play session length: A typical run can last up to about 30 minutes. (Also depends on the level; different levels have different timers).
